data.title: The 50+ Best NBA Point Guards on the Houston Rockets
data.meta_description: Over 500 sports fans have voted on the 50+ Best NBA Point Guards on the Houston Rockets. Current Top 3: Steve Francis, Chris Paul, Kenny Smith
data.text:
Ranked By

2.9K votes

596 voters

2 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Houston Rockets

Latest additions: Fred VanVleet

Most divisive: Bryce Drew

Over 500 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 50+ Best NBA Point Guards on the Houston Rockets

Big fan of Houston basketball? Then check out this list of Houston Rockets point guards. It includes every point guard throughout Houston Rockets history, including current point guards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA point guards of all time, the best Rockets PGs include Chris Paul, John Lucas II, Steve Francis, Sam Cassell, Kenny Smith, and Calvin Murphy.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Houston Rockets starting PGs and backup PGs are John Wall, Kevin Porter Jr., and D.J. Augustin.

Who are the best point guards in Houston Rockets history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Houston Rockets point guard of all time!

Birthplace : USA, Takoma Park, Maryland

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Point guard, Shooting guard

Houston Rockets: 1999–2004, 2007–2008

Drafted in 1999, Steve "Franchise" Francis earned his nickname through his six-year tenure with the Houston Rockets, where he emerged as one of the most talented and explosive point guards in the league. With a penchant for high-flying dunks and dazzling crossover moves, Francis quickly captured the hearts of Rockets fans. A three-time NBA All-Star during his time in Houston, Francis showcased his electrifying play style on the biggest stage, winning the 2000 NBA Slam Dunk Contest. Though he never claimed a championship with the franchise, Steve Francis remains an iconic figure in the Rockets' storied history.

Birthplace : Winston-Salem, North Carolina

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Phoenix Suns

Position : Point guard

Houston Rockets: 2017–2019

Acquired in a blockbuster trade in 2017, Chris Paul brought a wealth of experience and leadership to the Houston Rockets, making him one of the greatest point guards to don a Rockets uniform. Known for his exceptional court vision and unselfish play, Paul's cerebral approach to the game helped elevate the Rockets to new heights, as evidenced by their franchise-best 65-win season in 2017-18. During his tenure in Houston, Paul was selected as an NBA All-Star and earned All-NBA Team honors, further solidifying his reputation as an elite talent. Although he fell short of capturing a championship with the team, Chris Paul's impact on the Rockets' recent success should not be understated.

Birthplace : Queens, New York, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Point guard

Houston Rockets: 1990–1996

Emerging as a driving force on the Houston Rockets after being traded to the team in 1990, Kenny Smith solidified his position as one of the most talented point guards in franchise history. Known for his quick decision-making and electrifying playmaking abilities, Smith played a pivotal role in the Rockets' back-to-back NBA championships in 1994 and 1995. Not only did he average 17.7 points per game during the 1994 playoffs, but his iconic seven three-pointers in Game 1 of the 1995 NBA Finals stand as a testament to his clutch shooting. It was this championship pedigree that earned Smith the nickname "The Jet" and cemented his status as a Rockets legend.

Birthplace : Norwalk, Connecticut

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Houston Rockets

Position : Point guard

Houston Rockets: 1970–1983

Drafted by the Houston Rockets in 1970, Calvin Murphy's tenacious play style and sharpshooting capabilities earned him a spot among the franchise's all-time greats. Standing at only 5'9", Murphy's relentless work ethic and tenacity on the court quickly earned him the respect of both his teammates and opponents alike. His most notable achievement came in the 1977-78 season when he led the league in free-throw percentage, a testament to his unwavering dedication to perfecting every aspect of his game. A Hall of Famer who spent his entire 13-year NBA career with the Rockets, Calvin Murphy remains a cornerstone of the franchise's rich history.

Birthplace : Baltimore, Maryland

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Houston Rockets, Phoenix Suns, Dallas Mavericks, New Jersey Nets, Milwaukee Bucks

Position : Point guard

Houston Rockets: 1993–1996

Traded to the Houston Rockets in 1993, Sam Cassell made an immediate impact as a rookie, displaying an uncanny ability to thrive under pressure and make clutch shots. Cassell played an instrumental role in the Rockets' consecutive NBA championships in 1994 and 1995, scoring a career playoff-high 31 points in Game 2 of the 1995 Western Conference Finals. Known for his crafty ball-handling skills and elite scoring abilities, Cassell's time in Houston provided a glimpse of the All-Star point guard he would become later in his career. While his tenure with the Rockets was relatively brief, Sam Cassell's contributions to the franchise's most successful era are indelible.

Birthplace : Gastonia, North Carolina

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Point guard

Houston Rockets: 1987–1993

Joining the Houston Rockets in 1988 after a trade, Eric "Sleepy" Floyd brought a smooth, efficient game to the team, earning him recognition as an all-time great Rockets point guard. Possessing a silky jump shot and superb ball-handling skills, Floyd provided the Rockets with a reliable and consistent scoring option throughout his four seasons with the team. Though he never captured an NBA title or earned significant individual accolades in Houston, Sleepy Floyd's steady contributions and professional demeanor solidified his place in the hearts of Rockets fans.
